column4: Ok, what is the equivalent of postgresql-server-dev-8.0 in Ubuntu?
search for it?
Only debian packages available :(
no apt-file either in Ubuntu :(
http://packages.ubuntu.com/breezy/misc/postgresql-8.0 that what you're after?
Probably not. I need the server developement headers.
how about http://packages.ubuntu.com/breezy/libs/postgresql-8.0-plr then
Not the normal server, but the headers needed to compile server extensions against.
just look at http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=postgresql&searchon=names&subword=1&version=breezy&release=all and see if any of that helps :)
It's curious, the search, when I enter postgresql source package, finds all packages derived from that source. All packages are there, just postgresql-server-dev-8.0 is displayed without a link.
What does it mean when the search shows a package, but not linked?
i've got a link to that package?!
http://packages.ubuntu.com/breezy/libdevel/postgresql-server-dev-8.0 ?
But this page doesn't have a download link for the .deb :(
apt doesn't find it either.
oh right :) just use synaptic and make sure you've got the universe respositories added
I do have.
And synaptic is just the gui.
ok use aptitude instead if you want CLI ;)
What's the difference to apt?
you SURE you have universe added?
just do postgresql and look through them just to be sure then
